title: 111_hr4943
content: The Act is titled the "Informed Taxpayers' Federal Government Annual Reporting Act of 2010" and includes annual federal government financial information in Form 1040 instructions. The Secretary of the Treasury prepares an annual report for each fiscal year to be included in tax return instructions. The report includes divisions on current federal government finances, federal government finances & you, and projected federal government finances. The annual report prepared by the Secretary of the Treasury includes sections on current federal government finances, which details revenues, outlays, budget deficit or surplus, and gross Federal debt. It also covers the comparison of deficits or surpluses between fiscal years. Additionally, it provides information on income tax filers and nonfilers among U.S. households. The summary includes information on income tax filers and nonfilers, total gross Federal debt per individual with income tax liability, and projected federal government finances with revenue estimates. The summary described in this paragraph provides estimates of federal government revenues, outlays, budget deficits or surpluses for the next fiscal year and the following 10 years. It also includes projections of the total gross Federal debt for the same period, based on estimates from the Congressional Budget Office. The report required under this section shall be written in a manner understandable to the average person and prominently displayed near the beginning of tax return instructions and on the IRS website.
